intro: Ceraia tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed ceraia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
